free: #e He already died.
#c 那位（他）已過世。
#e He died at the age when Pawan was small.
#c 在這Pawan小的時候那位（他）就已過世。
#e He fought with others, and he died.
#c 他因（與別人）打架而死去。
#e He was about thirty years old.
#c 約死於30歲。
#e He was ill for a long time.
#c (因打架的傷)身體羸弱很久。
#e Were you a child at that time?
#c 你（Pawan）那時還小嗎？
#e Their siblings were all small. Their mothers was very diligent (so that she could bring up children.)
#c 他們（指Pawan的兄弟姐妹）都還小，他們的媽媽很能工作（才得以養育其子女）。
#e At that time I was still small. I went to do...
#c 我那時還小，是我去做。
#e At that time, I went with elders to hunt game for us to eat.
#c （那時）家裡有獵物可食用是由我跟隨族人去打獵而得的。
#e It should be after you had grown up. How can you go hunting in such a small age?
#c 那（隨族人去打獵）應是你長大後的事了吧，你小時候不可能去。
#e I did, I rarely did farmwork when I was young.
#c 不是哦，我從小經常不做農務。
#e and I played chasing mouse since small,
#c 而從小就以獵田鼠為樂。
#e I followed elders to go hunting.
#c 且跟著族人們去狩獵。
#e Do you only have one elder sister?
#c 你(Pawan)僅有一位姐姐是嗎？
#e How can you go to hunt? You are too small to put a trap at that time. Pawan, when your father left you, you were still small.
#c 怎麼可能去（狩獵）..你（當時）年紀那麼小怎麼可能去放陷阱，Pawan你父親丟下你的時候（指你父親早逝），你還小。
#e At that time when Awi Takun was alive, I had already hunted a bear.
#c Awi Takun還活著時（那時）我已經獵到熊了。
#e Were your father still alive at that time?
#c （那時）你父親還健在嗎？
#e He was still alive. After that, I hunt another bear with Pawan Muhing.
#c 我父親還健在..之後我又與Pawan Muhing協力獵到熊（另一隻）。
#e yes, I remember you caught bear twice in a row with Awi Takun and others.
#c 是的（我曉得）..那時候你相繼與Awi Takun他們獵獲熊。
#e Yes.
#c 是的。
#e About what age did you go hunting with elders?
#c 你跟隨他們（狩獵）時是幾歲呢？
#e About twelve or eleven.
#c 約12或11歲。
#e twelve?
#e it should be about twelve or thirteen
#e How was it possible? Eleven years old is too small to go hunting.
#c 你不可能會（打獵）..11（歲）太小了，
#e You should have been thirteen or fourteen when you learn a little hunting skill.
#c 約13歲左右你才會稍懂得狩獵。
#e Yes, I was really about twelve, my height was tall enough you know.
#c 不，我約11（歲），我本來就個兒高大。
#e Even if you are tall...
#c 即使個兒高大也..
#e I have not recorded yet how your father died.
#c 是如何..你父親是因何過世，我剛才尚未錄得。
#e I see.
#c 知道。
#e Tell me in detail from the beginning.
#c 請詳述，從頭說。
#e Since he was beaten by others, he died
#c 因（家父）與其他族人鬥毆而死的。
#e What is the reason they beat your father.
#c 他們鬥毆的原因是什麼呢？
#e He was pounded by mallet.
#c （家父）被對方用杵具鎚擊。
#e What is the reason they beat your father.
#c 他們鬥毆的原因是什麼呢？
#e For the reason of Mona Rudo, they went angry.
#c 是起因於Mona Rudo與對方發生爭執。
#e and then my father defended Mona Rudo. So they pounded him with mallet.
#c 家父則為Mona Rudo出頭，被對方以杵具鎚擊結果（家父）...
#n seru 粗杵(搗麻糬用)
#e Who thursted your father?
#c 是誰槌擊（您父親）的？
#e People from Bkasan village
#c 是來自Bkasan部落的族人。
#e People from Bkasan village?
#c Bkasan部落的族人嗎？
#e A person called Kuwa.
#c 一個叫做Kuwa的族人。
#e (A person called) Kuwa.
#c （是叫做）Kuwa (的人)。
#e Were they from Bkasan village? Hadn't they moved to Boarung village at that time?
#c 是來自Bkasan部落的族人嗎？當時他們（指Bkasan部落的族人）尚未遷至Boarung部落嗎？
#e Not yet, they still lived in Bkasan.
#c 還沒有，還居住在Bkasan部落。
#e They had moved from Pradu village to Bkasan village, is that right?
#c （Bkasan部落的族人）是由Pradu部落（遷至Bkasan部落）是嗎？
#e Yes, they originally moved from Pradu to Bkasan.
#c 是的..（他們）從Pradu部落遷至Bkasan部落。
#e At first, they escaped (from quake site) separately.
#c 當初他們是因逃難而分散的。
#n Pradu village suffered from landslide trigged by an earthquake. Pradu部落因地震遭山崩之土石所掩埋.
#e So, my father may have been to Bkasan vilaage to attend ceremony in my sister's husband's house.
#c 所以..（家父）可能是去..到Bkasan部落時受宴於姐妹的先生家飲酒。
#n ane堂表親姐妹的丈夫
#e My uncle, Ruwah, lived in Bkasan.
#c 我舅舅Ruwah就住在Bkasan。
#e Ruwah is my mother's brother.
#c （Ruwah）是我媽媽的哥哥。
#e Did Ruwah live in Bkasan there (at that time)?
#c Ruwah（當時是）居住在Bkasan部落那邊嗎？
#e Yes, he lived in Bkasan.
#c 是居住在Bkasan部落。
#e Kuwa was beaten (by our relatives of Mhebu) somehow.
#c Kuwa被（我們馬赫坡部落的親戚）揍。
#e Was it at the new bridge (by our Mhebu tribe)?
#c 是在我們（馬赫坡部落）的新橋處嗎？
#e I know that.
#c 我知道這件事。
#e My father once passed that bridge and went to Busi village, carrying me on his back.
#c 從對岸過（的那座橋），（有一次）家父揹著我（經過那座橋）要到Busi部落。
#e At that time, your father was still healthy. He was not sick yet.
#c 那是在你父親還健康的時候吧，還沒生病..
#e Did your father ill for a long time after he was pounded?
#c 你父親從那次被毆傷後休養很久是嗎？
#n m-iiyax 受傷後不工作(休息療養)。
#e My father suffered from chest pain all the time.
#c （家父）就一直有胸痛的病情。
#e Pawan's father was ill for a long time then.
#c 那時（Pawan的父親）就一直生病了。
#e Because Kuwa people pounded his chest, it caused him chronic chest pain.
#c 就是因被（Kuwa）以杵具槌擊胸部後，引起（家父）胸部長期的病痛。
#e (At that time in our village) no doctor.
#c （當時我們部落）沒有醫生。
#n eiuy 藥物(治療藥物、農藥、毒品)
#e (If the accident had not occurred to his father), Pawan's mother would have had more children.
#c (如果Pawan的爸爸沒發生這意外），Pawan的母親也應該有更多的子女。
#e He started to be sick around thirty years old.
#c 約30多歲時（開始）生病。
#e So, how many years had he been sick in your memory?
#c （他病了多少年？)依你的印象？
#e He was sick for more than ten years.
#c （他）病了10幾年。
#e For more than fifty years..
#c 五十幾年喔。
#e Was your father sick for fifty years?
#c 你父親病了50多年？
#e Yes.
#c 是的。
#e Such a long time.
#c 那麼久。
#n IU86 Dakis mistook what Pawan said. Dakis當時聽錯. IU92 Pawan seemed not understood Dakis's answer. 當時Pawan也似乎沒聽清楚Dakis的回答.
#e My father coughed everyday.
#c （家父那時）就天天咳嗽。
#e His illness was so serious that he could not get up by himself for a long time.
#c （他）病得很嚴重，病得很長一段時間無法起身。
#e Since then, you went to hunt following elders...
#c 從那時起你跟隨族人去...
#e Our family only had me to go hunting.
#c （我家）就由我跟隨族人上山狩獵.
#n 跟隨前去幫忙，就可以獲得一部分獵物；不勞而獲，對接受者而言並不好。
#e Others also told about Pawan family's situation like that.
#c 別人也會（將Pawan的情況）向族人說的。
#e Let me stop here for a moment.
#c 先暫停。
#e OK.
#c 好的。
#e I chased mice. Our family's game was mainly mice.
#c 獵田鼠，我家的獵物幾乎以田鼠為主。
#n Because Pawan was still small at that time, he could only chase mice. 因Pawan還小只能獵田鼠。
#n wana = wano "only"
#e Mona Rudo played a role of your care-taker?
#c Mona Rudo幾乎扮演著養育你的長輩是嗎？
#e Then Mona Rudo also did not let me go to school.
#c 可以說是Mona Rudo不讓我上學校唸書。
#n 因為Pawan父親早逝，需依靠Mona Rudo
#e He took care of me
#c 他照護著我。
#e So he took care of your family.
#c 由他照護著你一家人。
#e and he did not allow my mother to remarry.
#c 也不讓家母改嫁。
#e I see.
#c 嗯..
#e When my mother remarried, he took her back home. He forced her go home.
#c 家母改嫁時（Mona Rudo）又將她帶回家, 硬將家母帶回家。
#e It was when she went to remarry Pukuh Takun of Drodux village.
#c 就如..有一次（家母）改嫁到Drodux部落的Pukuh Takun。
#e Is he the Pukuh Takun you mentioned?
#c 你曾提過的那位Pukuh Takun..是嗎？
#e (Mona Rudo thought) If my mother got remarried, our children would be miserable (since we would be buried in the step-father's house.)
#c （Mona Rudo）認為，若家母改嫁，我們做子女的會很可憐（會在繼父家受欺負）。
#e (Elders of our family) they told like this.
#c （家族的長輩們）是這麼說的。
#e About him (Mona Rudo)?
#c 是他（Mona Rudo）嗎？
#e Because we were relatives.
#c 因為我們是親戚。
#e My father helped Mona Rudo, when he was alive. Thus, after my father passed away, he helped us.
#c 家父生前常幫助Mona Rudo，所以家父過逝後他（Mona Rudo）也幫助我們。
#e This is a mutual matter.
#c 這是互相的。
#e He rushed to bring us up, and we would help him after we grew up.
#c 他（Mona Rudo）要趕快把我們養大，待我們長大後又可以幫他。
#e I see.
#c 嗯。
#e When your father passed away, how old were you?
#c 你父親身故時你大約幾歲？
#e I could shoulder at that time.
#c 我當時我已會扛東西了。
#n IU132 This is a way to express one's age. By the ablity to shoulder staff, his age can be guessed. 這是Seediq的表達方式，在此以〝會扛東西〞來表示自己約有十二、三歲.
#e About sixteen years old?
#c （那時）你約16歲嗎？
#e About thirteen
#c 約13歲。
#e About thirteen to fourteen years old?
#e since I could shoulder staff.
#c （那時）我已很能扛東西了。
#e When your father passed away, how did you bury him? Where did you bury him?
#c （你們父親過逝時）以何種方式埋葬.. 你父親..埋在何處？
#e We wrapped him with cloth.
#c 用布匹(pala)裹著。
#e We wrapped him with cloth,
#c 用布匹(pala)裹著。
#e with big cloth.
#c 用大布匹(pala)裹著。
#e I heard the hole in the past was dug like this. You did not let the corpse lay flat, right?
#c 聽說你們以前的（墓穴）是挖掘成這個樣子，不讓（死者）躺平是嗎？
#e We did not let a corpse lay flat.
#c 不讓（死者）躺平。
#e We let them crouch.
#c 讓（死者）盤腿著地。
#e We dug grave with a hoe.
#c （墓穴）用鋤頭挖掘。
#e Where did you bury them?
#c 你們將（死者）葬於何處？
#e We buried them where you and me have passed...
#c 就葬在有..我們（Pawan和我）曾去過的有...
#e Is it where there are houses?
#c 就是有家屋那兒嗎？
#e At that time, didn't we bury in house?
#c 那時本族沒有屋內葬嗎？
#n h<m>abung：蓋墳墓(只適用於人)；rumeus：掩埋(適用於人、物)
#e We no more buried under house at that time. My father is also there.
#c 那個時候已沒有（屋內葬）了，先父也葬在那兒.
#n 只能埋葬在自己的土地上。
#e Didn't People of our tribe bury corpse in house?
#c 本族不在屋內挖墓嗎？
#n kali: 語言；挖
#e No bury in house.
#c 不葬在屋內。
#e No bury in house.
#c 不葬在屋內。
#e We did not bury under house any more at that time? Have you ever seen burying in house?
#c 你們（那個年代）已不葬在屋內了嗎？妳曾見過屋內葬？
#n IU158 Dakis is asking Tiwas. Dakis在請教Tiwas.
#e Did you seeour people buried in house?
#c 妳看過（本族）有屋內葬嗎？
#e No, I have not.
#c 沒見過。
#e I have seen a people buried under storehouse. I was looking at it like this.
#c 我見過（葬在）穀倉地基底下者，就像這樣看著。
#e Were they buried under storehouse?
#c （葬在）穀倉地基底下嗎？
#e I have not seen burying in house, I have only seen burying under a storehouse.
#c （沒見過葬在）住家屋內者，見過（葬在）穀倉地基底下者。
#e (During Japanese period,) they opened a place for cemetery. Since then, we bury people in Tlwayan.
#c （在日治時期）將公墓設在Tlwayan了，先父即葬在那兒。
#n IU167 it is possible that smeling = smeli.
#e I know. I have heard of this. There is a cemetry and a house like thing.
#c 我曉得，（某人）告訴我的..（墓地那兒）有那個(家屋)..在製作。
#n A storehouse of Seediq people was made on high poles. 賽德克族的穀倉屬高腳屋.
#e My father is also there.
#c 先父葬在那兒。
#e The road bound to the cemetery is there. That road has a stump like this. Whenever I passed there, I would turn aside, because I felt fear passing there.
#c 到那墓地的路在那邊，那條路像這樣有樹根（樹頭），我經過那條路時我都會逃開，因我怕經過那墳墓之地。
#e Tiwas does not pass there any more.
#c Tiwas，現今的道路已不經過那邊了。
#e Where did that road go to?
#c （那現今的）路經過哪裡了呢？
#e You took another route.
#c 經過別處。
#e We had to climb.
#c 要爬過。
#e I felt so scared passing the cemetry there.
#c 害怕經過那墳墓之地, Pawan，即使是我用想像的依然會害怕，經過.. 我都會逃開，我打從心理（由衷）的害怕。
#e via the road above...
#c 經過上方的路。
#e Pawan, get it (for me).
#c Pawan，拿一下。
#e You know we buried under a storehouse, is that right?
#c 妳知道（葬在）穀倉地基底下的是嗎？
#e I know that.
#c 那我知道。
#e Have you ever seen it?
#c 妳曾見過嗎？
#e I saw it.
#c 我見過。
#e How did not we have custom burying in house?
#c 如何.. 本族人沒有葬在住家屋內的嗎？
#e We did not.
#c 沒有。
#e People of Bgala (who belong to Squliq Atayal) have a custom burying in house.
#c 眉原群（Bgala屬泰雅族澤敖利系統）的人有採屋內葬。
#e So, people of Bgala have a custom buring in house.
#c 是眉原群的人有採屋內葬嗎？
#e We buried under storehouse, is that right?
#c 本族是葬在穀倉地基底下嗎？
#e Under storehouse.
#c （葬在）穀倉地基底下。
#e not exactly under storehouse, we buried them outside of house like a yard of own house.
#c 也不是（葬在）穀倉..就如住家的院子外，屬自己家的院子。
#e So we buried corpse in yard?
#c 本族以前的死者就葬在那兒（院子）嗎？
#e We did not bury somebody else's yard. We buried them in our own yards.
#c 我們不會葬到別人的院子，是葬在自家的院子。
#e Under the own ground.
#c （葬在）屬於自己的地。
#e Under the own ground. We don't bury the dead in each other's land.
#c （葬在）屬於自己的私有地. 我們不會互相埋在對方的地。
#e It's like we buried them under the orange trees. My late grandfather were buried under oranges trees like that.
#c 就像葬在橘子樹之下(的位置)，先祖父就葬在像那樣的橘子樹之下。
#e Was that field cultivated by you, or did it belong to your land?
#c 屬於妳們的耕作地嗎？那地是我們自己的私有地嗎？
#e That was our land.
#c 我們自己的地。
#e Takun Boxin was buried under a storehouse, under my later grandmother's orange trees.
#c Takun Boxin就葬在穀倉地基底下.. 葬在我先祖母的橘子樹之下。
#e He bought big pot while alive. He was put inside the pot with big mouth.
#c 他（生前）就先預購了甕，他被放進大甕中，大口的甕中（再葬入墓穴中）。
#n In that age, people who could buy a big pot belonged to rich class. 在那個年代，能購得大甕者即屬富有者.
#e Was your late father also put in the pot?
#c 令先父也被放進大甕中嗎？
#e It is my grandfather who was in pot.
#c 有被放進大甕的是先祖父。
#e About...
#c 大約...
#e He was put into the pot.
#c 有被放進大甕。
#e Who taught us to bury the dead like this?
#c （生前）這種埋法是誰教的？
#e It was grandfather himself (that ordered the pot).
#c 是他（先祖父）自己（要先預購大甕的），
#e It is big enough to put corpse.
#c （那大甕的口）足以讓死者放入。
#n seediq = seedaq
#e Did people prepare to order a pot while they are alive?
#c 有族人生前也預先準備大甕的嗎？
#e He bought the pot with a big mouth by himself. They prepared first.
#c 大口甕是他自己買的。（他們）會預先準備。
#e They may buy it by themselves.
#c 是他們自己買的吧？
#e They ordered the pot they will use after they were dead.
#c 他們會預先準備死後要用的大口甕。
#e I have read in a book that our people had custom of burying in house.
#c 我看過文獻資料提到本族是採屋內葬。
#e no, it is Bgala.
#c 沒有, 泰雅族眉原群才有。
#e It was Bgala people who had that custom.
#c 原來（採屋內葬的）是泰雅眉原群的人。
#e Bgala people, as well as Toda people.
#c 泰雅眉原群的人採屋內葬..還有賽德克Toda群的人。
#e Do Toda people have custom of buring in house? I do not know that.
#c Toda群的人採屋內葬，我是不曉得。
#e Toda people buried in house.
#c Toda群的人..葬在家屋內。
#e We possibly had a custom of buring in house, but we were not in time to witness that.
#c 或許我們的先祖也曾採屋內葬，只是我們沒看過（沒能趕上）。
#e I have heard that when someone makes fire, our ancestors buried under bed scramble for the fire.
#c 聽說我們的先祖曾將亡者葬在（亡者生前）臥榻下方的地裡..，當其家人要生火時他們（亡者的亡靈）會搶著生火。
#e When we eat, the ghosts also scramble for meal.
#c 要吃飯時他們（亡者的亡靈）也會搶著先吃。
#e Pawan, I heard at that time, when we bury them, we did not bring wood ash (ash produced by burning wood for housework).
#c Pawan，聽說那時候，（族人們）要安葬死者時沒帶木灰（家中生火的灰燼）。
#e After we scattered ash, the ghosts would be gone.
#c 後來族人們撒了木灰之後..就不見（亡者的亡靈）了。
#e (We did not scatter wood ash). We buried them directly (during the age of that custom). We could see a ghost of the person came to eat food.
#c （不撒木灰）直接將亡者安葬... （那樣安葬的年代裡）可看到亡者的亡靈來吃東西。
#e We did not scatter ash? What does it mean not scattering ash?
#c 不放木灰？什麼叫做不放木灰？
#e That ash was produced of woods we used for making fires.
#c 那木灰就是我們生火的灰燼。
#e Where did you scatter ash?
#c 木灰要放在哪裡？
#e There was a person came from back like this.
#c 一個人---在後面這樣來。
#e People shoulder the corpse, and there was one person in the back scattering ash like this. People who carried were in front
#c 送葬的人扛著亡者，有人殿後這樣放木灰. 扛亡者的人們走在前面。
#e and the person who is scattered was in the back (He scattered ash along the road).
#c 有殿後者提著木灰（在送葬的路上沿途撒木灰）。
#e Who scatterd ash?
#c 是誰做（執行）撒木灰的行動？
#e Another person.
#c 另外一個人。
#e A child.
#c 小孩。
#e A child.
#c 小孩。
#e A child, a woman or  anyone could do it?
#c 是小孩、或是女性、或者任何人都可以？
#e Anyone would do.
#c 任何人都可以。
#e Should he be a relative of a dead person, or it does not matter?
#c 一定要是亡者的親戚嗎？或者不一定（沒關係）？
#e He should be a relative.
#c 要與亡者有親戚關係者。
#e Like siblings of the dead.
#c 如亡者的兄弟姐妹。
#e Person who has relative relationship with the dead.
#c 我們與亡者有親戚關係者。
#e Did you scatted ash along a road?
#c 沿路撒木灰嗎？
#e From that time a ghost will come to scramble for food with people alive.
#c 從那時就沒有亡靈來與活著的人搶著吃的（東西）。
#e I heard we could see their hand but could not see their body.
#c 據說活著的人可看到亡靈們的手，但卻看不到亡靈們的身軀。
#e Since then, the invisible ghost competes with us with his hand. People alive scramble for food, the ghost also scramble for food.
#c 從那時起，就看不到亡靈們的手搶著拿吃的東西，活著的人要拿（東西）亡靈們也搶著要拿東西。
#e Ghosts would get drunk themselves blind too.
#c 亡靈們也會肩搭著肩酒醉。
#e People alive could see them like that.
#c 活著的人可看得到。
#e A story like this is not a lie. It is true. It is what Mona Rudo told me.
#c 這樣的傳說不是誆人的，而是真的.這樣的傳說是Mona Rudo告訴我的。
#e Not only him, our elderly people all could tell this story.
#c 不是只有他（Mona Rudo）有傳述，所有的族老都會傳述。
#e I heard that corpse were buried under beds. Ghosts scramble for fire when people maked fire.
#c 聽說那時我們將亡者葬在（亡者生前）臥榻下方的地裡..，當我們要生火時他們會搶先生火。
#e Elderly people said they could see drunken ghost with shoulder crossing shoulder in Pradu village,
#c 他們（族老們）說Pradu部落被..，他們看到亡靈們肩搭著肩酒醉。在Pradu部落那兒
#e since the place was buried by landslide.
#c 因Pradu部落地震時被山崩的土石所掩埋。
#e I see. The place was buried by landslide.
#c 是的（就是那樣），被山崩的土石所掩埋。
#e XXX
#c XXX
